div1.p:
39.
Hester Stephens
was indicted on Suspicion of
picking the Pocket of
William Rutter
of a Silver Snuff-Box .

William Rutter
. On the 7th of December , about Seven at Night, coming from Cold-bath Fields, just before I came to the End of Mutton-Lane, I saw a Man staggering and falling down; I lifted him up, else he had been run over, had I not come by and saved him. I went into the Magpye Alehouse, just by, and calling for a Pint of Ale and Gin, I filled my Pipe and smoked, and pulled my Snuff-Box out of my Pocket. Said I to my Landlady, I believe you are a Welsh-woman. This Woman, (the Prisoner) sat by me, I gave her my Box to take a Pinch of Snuff, she return'd it, and I put it up in my Breeches Pocket; when I had paid my Reckoning I went out to the Door, and the Prisoner at the Bar came to me and took me by the Arm, and walked with me over Clerkenwell-Green towards St. John's Wall. I put my Left Hand about her Neck, and gave her a Kiss; while my Left Hand was round her Neck, her Right Hand was in my Pocket; I presently missed my Box, but away she ran, and I said give me my Box. She d - n'd me and said, touch me if you dare; which I was afraid to do, as she might have some Accomplices. I said, I will never leave you till I bring you to Justice. When I got her into St. John's-Street, there I was inform'd of an Officer. It wanted but a Quarter of an Hour of Nine o'Clock before I could get it settled. After she had been charged about an Hour, she walked out under a Pretence to find my Box; she sent a Watchman to fetch her Landlady; who answer'd, what is the Matter? I'll be hang'd if she has not picked the Gentleman's Pocket.
Q. So, you lost your Box?
Rutter. Yes, she did her Work very quick.
Q. Then you did not find her Hand in your Pocket?
Rutter. I felt her Hand, and then follow'd her, and said, I would not leave her till I had my Box again.

Q.
(to the Prisoner.) What have you to say for yourself?
Prisoner. Please you, my Lord, I know nothing of it.

Q.
(to Rutter.) Did you not say you could not be positive she took it?
Rutter. My Lord, I know she took it: I had my Hand upon my Box five Minutes before she had it.
Prisoner. As I was going along, he wanted me to drink a Bottle of Wine with him: And because I would not go, he charged me with the Constable.

Q.
(to the Prisoner.) Have you any Witnesses?

Griffith Dowel
. I have known Haster Stephens above a Year and a half, and never heard any Harm of her.

Mary Cross
. I am a Washer of Gentlemen's Linnen, and have trusted her with all that I have, and never found her dishonest.

Sarah Hog
. I have known her some Years, she lodged at my House, and I never knew any Harm of her in my Life.
Acquitted .
